summary: The Coast Guard has begun acquiring new assets to replace its aging fleet, but it continues to lack a long-term plan to guide these efforts. For example, the Coast Guard is down to one polar icebreaker. And although the Coast Guard has expedited plans to acquire new icebreakers, the first ship may not be delivered on schedule. title: Coast Guard Acquisitions: Limited Strategic Planning Efforts Pose Risk for Future Acquisitions
